content: (formerly IBM Data Privacy Passports) provides end-to-end, data-centric encryption and privacy to keep your data protected no matter where it travels in your enterprise. It maintains the suitable use of data, revokes future access at any time, and keeps an audit trail, which permits only authorized users to extract value from your data. For more information, see this web page. 144 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide © Copyright IBM Corp. 2022. 145 Chapter 4. Central processor complex I/O structure This chapter describes the I/O system structure and connectivity options that are available on the IBM z16. This chapter includes the following topics:  4.1, “Introduction to I/O infrastructure” on page 146  4.2, “I/O system overview” on page 148  4.3, “PCIe+ I/O drawer” on page 151  4.4, “CPC drawer fan-outs” on page 154  4.5, “I/O features” on page 158  4.6, “Connectivity” on page 161  4.7, “Cryptographic functions” on page 192  4.8, “Integrated Firmware Processor” on page 195 4 146 IBM
